text: A more powerful Mac Mini is announced, but it is not a "Mac Mini Pro"
full-pick-text: A more powerful Mac Mini is announced, but it is not a "Mac Mini Pro"
notes:
• The Mac Studio is very close, but this pick was about the name and the Mac Studio, while very reminiscent of the Mini, is not named as such.
  • Just 2 weeks after the grading window closed, the M2 Pro Mac mini was announced.

text: A new AirPods product is announced
full-pick-text: A new AirPods product is announced
notes: • This pick was one event early, as the third generation of AirPods came in October.

text: A new Apple Display
full-pick-text: A new Apple Display

text: A new iPad comes in a new color for its line
full-pick-text: A new iPad comes in a new color for its line
notes: • The iPad mini would eventually fit this bill, coming in lots of fun new colors, but it wasn't released until September.

text: A new Smart Keyboard
full-pick-text: A new Smart Keyboard

text: A new smart keyboard: new material, backlit keys, a dedicated Siri key
full-pick-text: A new smart keyboard: new material, backlit keys, a dedicated Siri key
notes: • Apple's Magic Keyboard basically matching this description came out in 2020.

text: A new way to turn off confirmation banners in Shortcuts
full-pick-text: A new way to turn off confirmation banners in Shortcuts
notes: • This happened later in the iOS 15 cycle in version 15.4.

text: A new, unique case
full-pick-text: A new, unique case
notes: • Apple's case lineup would stay effectively unchanged until 2023, when the Fine Woven case replaced the leather case.

text: An iPhone gets an always-on display with a UI element that is reminiscent of Apple Watch complications
full-pick-text: An iPhone gets an always-on display with a UI element that is reminiscent of Apple Watch complications

text: AppKit and UIKit give birth to something new and cross-platform
full-pick-text: AppKit and UIKit give birth to something new and cross-platform
notes: • SwiftUI was announced in 2019.

text: Apple announces a Mac mini that is more performant than the original M1 model
full-pick-text: Apple announces a Mac mini that is more performant than the original M1 model
notes: • Stephen returns to the Mac mini, since it served him very well last year.

text: Apple announces a new display that is not the Pro XDR, launching by the end of 2021 somewhere
full-pick-text: Apple announces a new display that is not the Pro XDR, launching by the end of 2021 somewhere
notes:
• This was originally a pick about the Mac Pro being fully announced, but it was too close to Myke's risky pick.
  • The long-wished-for cheaper Apple display finally came out in 2022.

text: Apple announces a new Mac Pro powered by Apple Silicon
full-pick-text: Apple announces a new Mac Pro powered by Apple Silicon

text: Apple announces original podcast content
full-pick-text: Apple announces original podcast content
notes: • In 2020, Apple did come out with Apple News Today, and has since introduced other shows as well.

text: Apple announces Windows for ARM coming via virtualization in the future
full-pick-text: Apple announces Windows for ARM coming via virtualization in the future
notes: • Parallels was updated to do this by 2021, but it wasn't announced at this event.

text: Apple gives a sneak peak of the new Mac Pro...
full-pick-text: Apple gives a sneak peak of the new Mac Pro. It features a case design inspired by the 2019 Mac Pro. It features more ports than any other Apple Silicon Mac available today. It does not have support for third-party GPUs. It features a chip name that has not appeared in any other product. It has a starting price of at least $6,999. It is coming later this year.
notes:
• "...It features a case design inspired by the 2019 Mac Pro. It features more ports than any other Apple Silicon Mac available today. It does not have support for third-party GPUs. It features a chip name that has not appeared in any other product. It has a starting price of at least $6,999. It is coming later this year."
  • Originally it said "same case design", but the change was accepted on air after Myke reconsidered. "Later this year" was also demoted from being an exact quote.
  • This Mac Pro will have to beat the Mac Studio in terms of ports: 2 USB-C, 2 USB-A, 4 Thunderbolt, SD card, Ethernet, HDMI, and headphone jack, for a total of 12.
  • This pick is similar in spirit to Myke's ongoing Annual pick, but with different conditions. At the time it was the most complex graded pick ever made.

text: Apple has Apple Silicon versions of all of its Intel Macs on sale by the end of 2021
full-pick-text: Apple has Apple Silicon versions of all of its Intel Macs on sale by the end of 2021
notes:
• "No Intel Macs are available for sale without an Apple Silicon counterpart." Myke points out the iMac Pro as a potential spoiler.
  • (For pick complexity purposes, I'm counting this as 1 condition for each Mac line that still had no Apple Silicon counterpart at the beginning of 2021: The larger MacBook Pros, the iMac in both sizes, the iMac Pro, and the Mac Pro. The Mac mini is 1 line with a high end and low end, so it already had an "Apple Silicon counterpart" although the high end Mac mini was still Intel.)
  • The iMac Pro left the lineup entirely, but the Mac Pro remained on Intel for about a year and a half more.

text: Apple introduces a Copilot-like feature for Xcode powered by AI/ML
full-pick-text: Apple introduces a Copilot-like feature for Xcode powered by AI/ML
notes: • Not graded: "A feature in Xcode that uses AI/ML to suggest how to improve your code or solve common problems. It will most likely live in a sidebar and will probably be a Beta feature."

text: Apple launches a new HD tier for Apple Music
full-pick-text: Apple launches a new HD tier for Apple Music
notes: • This feature did come eventually, in 2021.

text: Apple launches an AR navigation mode for Apple Maps
full-pick-text: Apple launches an AR navigation mode for Apple Maps
notes: • A year too early, this was a feature in iOS 15.

text: Apple makes changes to the rules on in-app purchases, removing restrictions on linking to external websites for account creation, etc.
full-pick-text: Apple makes changes to the rules on in-app purchases, removing restrictions on linking to external websites for account creation, etc.
notes: • This came later in the year as a result of an antitrust settlement with Japan.

text: Apple Music will be redesigned again
full-pick-text: Apple Music will be redesigned again
notes:
• "Will gain more Spotify-like algorithmic features"
  • "An Apple version of the Daily Mix and a way to discover back catalog songs from artists you don't know (Discover Weekly?)"
  • The New Music Daily feature would eventually come in 2019.

text: Apple Notes will borrow some features from the modern generation of note-taking apps
full-pick-text: Apple Notes will borrow some features from the modern generation of note-taking apps, like wiki-style links, a quick switcher, or nested pages.
notes: • "...like wiki-style links, a quick switcher, or nested pages."

text: Apple puts a cheaper display on sale as a sibling to the XDR
full-pick-text: Apple puts a cheaper display on sale as a sibling to the XDR

text: Apple releases a weather API
full-pick-text: Apple releases a weather API
notes: • The revamped weather API was announced at WWDC in 2022.

text: Apple ships an AR, VR, and/or MR dedicated device
full-pick-text: Apple ships an AR, VR, and/or MR dedicated device

text: Apple TV box gets a price cut
full-pick-text: Apple TV box gets a price cut
notes: • After many, many years, Apple finally put out a slightly cut down Apple TV 4K for a lower price in 2022.

text: Apple TV+ will be free with another subscription
full-pick-text: Apple TV+ will be free with another subscription
notes: • Apple One, which includes Apple TV+, launched a year later.

text: Apple unveils a new external display
full-pick-text: Apple unveils a new external display

text: Apple unveils the first Mac powered by an M2 chip
full-pick-text: Apple unveils the first Mac powered by an M2 chip
notes: • Apple waited until WWDC to announce the M2 MacBook Air.

text: Apple Video and Apple Music have dedicated apps for Mac and iOS
full-pick-text: Apple Video and Apple Music have dedicated apps for Mac and iOS
notes:
• "Music and Video removed from iTunes on the Mac"
  • iTunes was eventually split up in 2019.

text: Apple Watch with an always-on display
full-pick-text: Apple Watch with an always-on display
notes: • The Series 5 watch added this feature in 2019.

text: Apple will also announce a service bundle to get multiple services for one integrated fee
full-pick-text: Apple will also announce a service bundle to get multiple services for one integrated fee
notes:
• Ironically, this was deemed insufficiently risky to be a Risky Pick.
  • Federico was a year early on this pick, as Apple One was introduced in October 2020.

text: Apple will introduce a new iMac design with an accompanying external display
full-pick-text: Apple will introduce a new iMac design with an accompanying external display
notes: • The new iMac design wouldn't come out until 2021, and the new display came in 2022.

text: Apple will name a successor to Steve Dowling, former head of public relations at Apple
full-pick-text: Apple will name a successor to Steve Dowling, former head of public relations at Apple
notes:
• "Either named by Apple officially, or reported by more than one outlet that a person has been appointed."
  • Clearly in no hurry to do this, Apple finally hired Stella Low to the role in 2021.

text: Apple will release at least 1 new pro app for iPad that we haven't previously seen on iPad
full-pick-text: Apple will release at least 1 new pro app for iPad that we haven't previously seen on iPad
notes:
• "(The app can be universal.)"
  • After years of waiting, Final Cut Pro and Logic Pro come to iPad in 2023.

text: Apple's classical music service is announced
full-pick-text: Apple's classical music service is announced

text: Apple's classical music service is unveiled
full-pick-text: Apple's classical music service is unveiled

text: At least one of the 2020 iPhones will have a higher refresh rate display (Pro Motion)
full-pick-text: At least one of the 2020 iPhones will have a higher refresh rate display (Pro Motion)
notes: • This feature did show up in the iPhone 13 line.

text: At least one of the Apple Silicon Macs has a Pro Motion display
full-pick-text: At least one of the Apple Silicon Macs has a Pro Motion display
notes:
• Was originally a Risky Pick.
  • ProMotion came to the Mac the next year with the MacBook Pro line.

text: At this event, we see some sort of AR-focused hardware
full-pick-text: At this event, we see some sort of AR-focused hardware

text: Better external display support on iPad
full-pick-text: Better external display support on iPad

text: Better incorporation of Apple News into the audio ecosystem

notes:
• For example, asking Siri for the news on a HomePod
  • This did eventually happen, but in 2020.

text: Big Sur gets a release date
full-pick-text: Big Sur gets a release date
notes: • This pick was just one event too early.

text: Big Sur on the new Apple Silicon Macs comes with a low power mode feature
full-pick-text: Big Sur on the new Apple Silicon Macs comes with a low power mode feature
notes: • This was a feature in Monterey the next year.

text: Catalina gets a release date
full-pick-text: Catalina gets a release date
notes: • This didn't happen until November 10th.

full-pick-text: Details of a new iPad mini
notes: • Also one year too early.

text: Developers will get tools for more control over refresh rate/frame rate in apps
full-pick-text: Developers will get tools for more control over refresh rate/frame rate in apps
notes: • Myke got points for a similar prediction the next year.

text: DriverKit comes to iPadOS to let more kinds of accessories be supported on iPad

full-pick-text: Faster MagSafe charging in at least one of the new iPhones

text: First ARM Mac ships
full-pick-text: First ARM Mac ships
notes: • Halfway through the year, Myke ups the ante: "If Stephen gets this right, I will buy you one, if the Mac Pro is an ARM Mac I will buy you the top of the line model."

text: iCloud family photo sharing
full-pick-text: iCloud family photo sharing
notes: • Finally got added in 2022 at WWDC.

text: Improved external display support for iPadOS
full-pick-text: Improved external display support for iPadOS
notes: • Finally came true in 2022 at WWDC.

text: iOS 10.3 with a redesigned split screen revealing the home screen and the app switcher instead of the vertical slider we have now
full-pick-text: iOS 10.3 with a redesigned split screen revealing the home screen and the app switcher instead of the vertical slider we have now
notes: • Two iPad multitasking refreshes later, a version that shows the home screen finally arrived in iPadOS 15.

text: iOS 14.5 will drop within 24 hours of the event
full-pick-text: iOS 14.5 will drop within 24 hours of the event
notes: • It was a week later.

text: iOS 15 drops support for the iPhone 6S
full-pick-text: iOS 15 drops support for the iPhone 6S
notes: • iOS 15 kept the 6S around for one more year, but iOS 16 finally dropped it.

text: iOS and iPadOS 15 get native HomeKit widgets
full-pick-text: iOS and iPadOS 15 get native HomeKit widgets
notes: • These came to the iOS 16 lock screen the next year.

text: iOS gets a native feature to change icons for any app you want
full-pick-text: iOS gets a native feature to change icons for any app you want

text: iPad Air preorder date announced
full-pick-text: iPad Air preorder date announced
notes: • Orders began on October 16th, with no advanced notice. Unfortunately, the picks had already been graded by then.

text: iPod Touch updated
full-pick-text: iPod Touch updated
notes: • The 7th generation update finally came in 2019.

text: iTunes rewrite or replacement for Mac OS
full-pick-text: iTunes rewrite or replacement for Mac OS
notes: • iTunes was eventually split up in 2019.

text: iWork updates for iOS 12
full-pick-text: iWork updates for iOS 12
notes:
• A week after grading, there is some controversy from the listeners and Federico, as iWork did get updated (well, slightly, a few basic Shortcut actions were added), it just wasn't mentioned in the keynote. Stephen proposes a placating half point, but Myke stands firm that "there are no half points around here." This seems to be the last time that half points were ever considered for a pick.
  • The big iWork update eventually came in 2019.

text: MagSafe is updated to support 20 watt charging or higher, but a new puck is required
full-pick-text: MagSafe is updated to support 20 watt charging or higher, but a new puck is required
notes: • This was originally just "faster charging", but the live chat pointed out a recent FCC filing by Apple which undercut the riskiness of the pick. Stephen added a specific wattage target and also had to decide whether the existing MagSafe puck will support the higher wattage.

text: Mail.app will get modern features like snoozing
full-pick-text: Mail.app will get modern features like snoozing
notes:
• Threads can be muted, which isn't what he was talking about, really.
  • As these are "ungraded picks" being, uh, graded, Stephen is given a half point because why not.
  • Apple finally added a few features to Mail in 2022 including snoozing.

full-pick-text: New AirPods or AirPods Pro
notes: • Not until October 18, 2021.

full-pick-text: New iMessage features, including the ability to retract sent messages

full-pick-text: New iPad Pro accessory

notes: • WIdgets would finally be added to the home screen in iOS 14.

notes:
• "With new family sharing features and integration with the HomePod."
  • The redesign of Reminders did come eventually in 2019, with many more new features in 2021.

text: Some surprise hardware, like a Tile tracker

notes: • Apple's tracker would eventually come out in 2021.

full-pick-text: Ted Lasso Season 3 trailer
notes: • Federico goes against Myke's earlier pick.

notes:
• The additional condition is an intentionally risky choice by Federico
  • Ultimately this is in fact his undoing. While AirPods Pro were released to split the line, the normal AirPods 2 didn't drop from their original $159 price until the 3rd generation was released in October 2021.

text: The Apple Watch SE gets a price cut
full-pick-text: The Apple Watch SE gets a price cut
notes: • Next year's model would, but not this year's.

text: The camera on the iPad Pro moves to the long side
full-pick-text: The camera on the iPad Pro moves to the long side

text: The iPad home screen will continue to change with new elements and additions
full-pick-text: The iPad home screen will continue to change with new elements and additions
notes: • The iPad went mostly unchanged in 2020, but iPadOS 15 did bring changes the next year.

text: The iPad mini will be updated with a new design inspired by the iPad Pro's design
full-pick-text: The iPad mini will be updated with a new design inspired by the iPad Pro's design
notes: • Stephen was almost exactly one year too early, as this would finally come true in 2021.

text: The iPad Pro, with an updated USB-4/Thunderbolt port, features a new kind of support for external displays
full-pick-text: The iPad Pro, with an updated USB-4/Thunderbolt port, features a new kind of support for external displays
notes:
• Ungraded: the multitasking system gets redesigned to better support external displays
  • The external display support finally came in 2022.

text: The iPhone 14 Pro Camera app introduces some kind of 3D capturing functionality

full-pick-text: The iPhone 14 Pro switches to titanium for the side rails
notes: • This was going to be a Risky pick, but rumors were found before the show.

text: The iPhone Pro comes in 5 colors/finishes, not the traditional 4
full-pick-text: The iPhone Pro comes in 5 colors/finishes, not the traditional 4
notes: • This unexpectedly came true in spring 2022, when Apple added a new green color to the Pro line.

text: The iPhone Pro moves to USB-C
full-pick-text: The iPhone Pro moves to USB-C
notes: • Stephen was very sure of this pick.

text: The iPod Touch is taken down from sale in the wake of the event
full-pick-text: The iPod Touch is taken down from sale in the wake of the event

text: The iPod Touch will be cancelled
full-pick-text: The iPod Touch will be cancelled
notes:
• The other hosts question the word "cancelled" here.
  • Finally came true in 2022.

text: The Mac Pro will ship by the end of 2018
full-pick-text: The Mac Pro will ship by the end of 2018
notes: • Later in 2018, Apple dashed Stephen's hopes of getting this correct. As promised, the Mac Pro came out in 2019.

text: The next HomePod is a mini HomePod
full-pick-text: The next HomePod is a mini HomePod
notes: • True, but too late. The HomePod mini wasn't released until 2020.

text: The next version of iOS lets you change icons for apps natively
full-pick-text: The next version of iOS lets you change icons for apps natively
notes: • "Without Shortcuts or custom profiles."

text: The Passwords feature of Settings becomes a standalone app
full-pick-text: The Passwords feature of Settings becomes a standalone app

text: The Weather app comes to iPad
full-pick-text: The Weather app comes to iPad

text: There will be a system filter for "always-on display" in Focus
full-pick-text: There will be a system filter for "always-on display" in Focus
notes: • Deemed incorrect because it wasn't mentioned and there was no way to find out at the time of grading. This was in fact the correct decision, as it was not present in iOS 16 originally. The feature did eventually arrive in iOS 16.4, so this pick was just a bit early.

text: Third party widgets gain interactivity
full-pick-text: Third party widgets gain interactivity
notes: • Edited to clarify "third party" as a few Apple widgets are already interactive.

text: Two new iPad Pros
full-pick-text: Two new iPad Pros
notes:
• "Maybe more of a hope"
  • As it turns out, there would later be a separate event for the iPad.

text: Updated Apple TV
full-pick-text: Updated Apple TV
notes: • Finally happened on April 20, 2021.

text: watchOS 7 will feature mental health features
full-pick-text: watchOS 7 will feature mental health features
notes: • watchOS 8 later added a Mindfulness app, expanding on the old Breathe app.

text: We get a colour option that is new to the MacBook Pro (name)
full-pick-text: We get a colour option that is new to the MacBook Pro (name)
notes:
• This was originally "new in name or hue", but some questioning of what a new hue would be resulted in relying solely on a new colour name.
  • Came true two years later... with "space black" replacing "space gray" in name at least.

text: We get new Macs
full-pick-text: We get new Macs
notes: • Ungraded: probably a new Mac mini

text: WidgetKit gains new interactivity features that allow you to perform actions inside widgets without launching the associated app
full-pick-text: WidgetKit gains new interactivity features that allow you to perform actions inside widgets without launching the associated app

text: WidgetKit will support new widget sizes and more interactivity
full-pick-text: WidgetKit will support new widget sizes and more interactivity
notes: • The boolean operator "and" ends up taking this pick down, as interactivity wouldn't come until 2023.
